com.example.as1

Class ActiveLineup

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.as1.ActiveLineup

  • public class ActiveLineup
extends java.lang.Object
    The ActiveLineup class manages the active brawler lineup in a game and allows for swapping and setting brawlers.
    Author:
    Drew Kinneer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Brawler getBrawler(int spot)
      The function returns the Brawler object at a specified spot in the lineup array.
      static ActiveBrawlerFrame[] getLineup()
      The function returns an array of ActiveBrawlerFrame objects representing a lineup.
      static boolean isLineupEmpty()
      This function checks if a lineup of brawlers is empty by iterating through each brawler and checking if it is null.
      static int numBrawlersInLineup() 
      static void removeBrawler(int index)
      The function removes a brawler from a lineup at a specified index.
      static void setBrawler(int spot, Brawler brawler)
      This function sets a Brawler object at a specific spot in an array and renders its stats.
      static void setFirstTurn(boolean firstTurn)
      This function sets the value of a boolean variable called "firstTurn" in the ActiveLineup class.
      protected void setLineup(int accountId)
      This function sets the lineup of brawlers for a given account by making a GET request to a specified URL and parsing the JSON response.
      static void swapLineupBrawlers(int newIndex, int currentIndex)
      The function swaps the positions of two brawlers in a lineup.

    • Method Detail

      • setLineup

        protected void setLineup(int accountId)
        This function sets the lineup of brawlers for a given account by making a GET request to a specified URL and parsing the JSON response.
        Parameters:
        accountId - The ID of the account for which the lineup is being set.

      • swapLineupBrawlers

        public static void swapLineupBrawlers(int newIndex,
                                      int currentIndex)
        The function swaps the positions of two brawlers in a lineup.
        Parameters:
        newIndex - The index of the lineup where the brawler will be moved to.
        currentIndex - The index of the brawler in the current lineup that needs to be swapped with another brawler.

      • setFirstTurn

        public static void setFirstTurn(boolean firstTurn)
        This function sets the value of a boolean variable called "firstTurn" in the ActiveLineup class.
        Parameters:
        firstTurn - a boolean variable that represents whether it is the first turn of the game or not. If it is the first turn, certain actions or rules may need to be adjusted accordingly.

      • isLineupEmpty

        public static boolean isLineupEmpty()
        This function checks if a lineup of brawlers is empty by iterating through each brawler and checking if it is null.
        Returns:
        The method `isLineupEmpty()` returns a boolean value. It returns `true` if the lineup is empty (i.e., all elements in the lineup array have a null brawler), and `false` otherwise.

        public static int numBrawlersInLineup()

        Returns:
        The method is returning an array of ActiveBrawlerFrame objects named "lineup".

      • setBrawler

        public static void setBrawler(int spot,
                              Brawler brawler)
        This function sets a Brawler object at a specific spot in an array and renders its stats.
        Parameters:
        spot - The spot parameter is an integer that represents the index of the Brawler in the lineup array that we want to set the new Brawler to.
        brawler - The "brawler" parameter is an object of the class "Brawler". It is being passed as an argument to the method "setBrawler" along with an integer value "spot". The method sets the brawler object at the specified spot in the "lineup" array and then calls

      • getBrawler

        public static Brawler getBrawler(int spot)
        The function returns the Brawler object at a specified spot in the lineup array.
        Parameters:
        spot - The parameter "spot" is an integer that represents the position of a brawler in a lineup. The method "getBrawler" returns the brawler object at the specified position in the lineup.
        Returns:
        The method `getBrawler` is returning an object of type `Brawler`. The specific `Brawler` object being returned depends on the value of the parameter `spot`, which is used to access an element of the `lineup` array and call the `getBrawler` method on it.

      • removeBrawler

        public static void removeBrawler(int index)
        The function removes a brawler from a lineup at a specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The parameter "index" is an integer value that represents the position of the brawler to be removed from the "lineup" array. The method "removeBrawler" takes this index as input and clears the element at that index in the "lineup" array.
